poem:
**Maria, Struck**

A stroll under the bright  
canopy of afternoon—  
shattered—  
a bullet's unexpected   
path through sinew and bones,  
  
even silence is pierced  
in the city's lush corners,  
wild creatures  
and humans alike  
find no refuge  
from the hard bite,  
unexpected,  
of steel.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Not even animals escape the extreme barbarity’: wildlife caught in Rio’s rampant gun crime Maria was taking an afternoon stroll through one of Rio’s most desirable neighbourhoods when her life was turned on its head. When she was carried into a nearby clinic, unable to move her legs, doctors suspected she had been electrocuted or mauled by a dog. The X-ray machine revealed a more sinister diagnosis: Maria had been shot, the bullet embedding itself". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
